My favorite bar in the mission.  Not pretentious, good music, interesting decor, cool dim red lighting, nice beer selection, cheap drinks..especially happy hour.  Also, you can get a nice pint of Russian River's Damnation for $4.50 here!!  It comes in a small wimpy tulip glass for $4 at Toronado's, so it's quite the deal!

I always have a good time when I come in here, even when it's kinda empty and even when it's crowded.  They also keep the door open, so you're guaranteed to be lured by the bacon wrapped hot dog smell that invades the place on certain nights.
author: Jung L.

description:
This place is awesome! Apke with his awesome parking karma (whether it's finding a place to park a car or his butt, he always finds a spot) landed us a table under the stairs here last Friday and it was the awesome. 

Had my first Cape Cod here and it was so good that I had to sit down. No, seriously. I couldn't stand after this thing! Things got very mushy and soft focused and I was feeling GOOD. Cool music though I can't remember anything specific. There was something cool being shown on the big screen too but again, the memory fails me.

Upstairs was smokey but since I didn't go up there, didn't bother me. Very cool place that I hope to visit again soon.
author: Christine K.

description:
This place is kind of like that friend of a friend who, whenever you meet, you embrace like your brother but after a few minutes of catching up you remember why friend of friend is where your relationship ends. I'm not sure why I find myself here so often. Past 8pm it usually crowded, far too loud and it takes way to f*ng long to get a drink but at the very least the DJ's are usually good selectors. There is a Juke Box with a not so varied but tasteful.  Just beyond the bathroom there is a little space out back with an upstairs that can be pretty comfortable depending on whom else you're sharing it with. One word of advice though. If the door to that area is closed and there is an inviting little sign that says free poetry on it...don't go any further it's a trap!  

I made the mistake of venturing into this forbidden zone only to find out there is no mechanisms to keep the door closed, no door stop, Nada. I stand there without a clue as the music from the main bar (way to loud) is making it impossible to hear. So the lovely brown girl who is apparently in charge comes at me with the wrath of the math, the poor chump who has the rotten luck being in the middle of reading when I make my oh so suave entrance is looking at me like I just slapped his moms and the rest of room is looking at me like WTF?. My question is how the hell am I supposed to know that the payphone to the left is what I'm supposed to use to rig the door. What am I f*n MacGyver.  Any way as far as Dalva goes, why not give it shot. If it blows you're already smack dab in the middle of party central, step out on to 16th and pick a direction.
author: Mingus R.

description:
Tuesday: 12/192006 
- 09:36p Arrival
- 09:58p Departure

My date and I decided to stop by Dalva first before meeting some friends at Delirium. This bar is cozy -- I like the chill atmosphere.  There was an imbalance of sexes (way too many single men), but I was totally digging the music.  We each enjoyed a bottle of PBR ($2.75/each) as we watched "Live and Let Die (Roger Moo7re)" on the big television screen.  

Dalva is great and I will be back again because even though there was a DJ spinning, the music wasn't too loud and I was still able to hear my date trying to sweet talk me :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
Whoa...it's dark in this bar.  But I kinda love that about it.  Once my eyes adjusted, I realized that this bar is AWESOME. After a quick scan of the draught beers, I had a hankering for Hefeweizen.  Back in my college days in the good ol' midwest, I drank A LOT of Hefeweizen.  

More recently, I visited my bff from college in Minneapolis where I delighted her with my knowledge of Hangar One (they do sell it there, it's just not as easy to find).  However, the best times I had there were not bragging about our California fruit infused vodkas but drinking beers at a dive bar on the outskirts of the city.  I have a special place in my heart for midwestern dive bars and sippin' on that Hefeweizen at Dalva took me back.

Also, it is super cool that they serve the Hefeweizen in such a huge glass.  My drinking companion was upset that theirs wasn't so grand.  After dinner, we decided to go back to Dalva and since it was a little darker, my eyes didn't need to adjust.  Not that I would have minded...just sayin'.
author: Rosie F.

description:
I was happy when Bar Night found Dalva, mainly because it's was closer to my house than any of the other bars we went to. Aside from the  convenience factor, Dalva is easily the best bar on that terrible 16th St stretch. Easily.
Dalva always has good movies playing. There have been times when I have been so engrossed by a movie that I have ignored the people I was with. They have Death and Taxes on tap. There's a "secret" back room where you can smoke, or you used to be able to smoke. There's an even more secret room upstairs from the back room. And I know no one believes me because my credibility for the "truth" is suspect, but the last Wednesday of the month used to be free wine tasting. 
But the absolute best thing about Dalva is Barry, the bouncer. I'm not sure when he works, but he's the big tall guy. I love seeing that big smiling face.
author: Daniella C.

description:
The ultimate mood place to take that hottie hipster date you just scored at Casanova's on Sunday afternoon. Dark and slick and all candley in the best possible ways.....it just reeks smoove-ability. Seriously, you come here on a chill weekday and its like an extra +1 on your game.

For a sure fire home run, practice that long gaze, that rakish grin, those "come hither" seduce me eyes at home first, and let the red candles do the rest. Oh yeah-it's on like donkey kong.

oh, they have good drinks too....but c'mon...its all about the smoove....
author: Tim V.

description:
Dalva's pretty awesome, but I can't put my finger on why I think that. The room is kind of a shambles, it gets totally crowded, my friend had her purse stolen here once, the bathroom's a dive, and there's pretty frequently sketchy dealings going on right outside or in the back room. 
Oh, wait; apparently I can put my finger on it. Those are all kind of awesome (aside from the purse-stealing bit) if you're into that scene. 

Lately I've been ordering the sangria here, which seems odd I know, but is actually tasty and will get you totally hammered. And it'll get you part of your RDA of fruit. That's what I tell my nutritionist anyway.
author: Leah S.

description:
Land of the Lost, Sigmund and the Sea Monster, Jim Nabors in a robot costume... YES YES early 70's kids shows make me laugh and think of my siblings huddled on the couch!!

This is a galley bar with art on the walls and friendly bartenders that look like hipsters but don't act like hipsters. In fact, whoa, they actually had a few words to say .. 

Dropped by the night of Thanksgiving because dinner was too much to contemplate and drinks sounded like the best 'snack'. Got a G&T that didn't have a lot of power, frankly, so that kills the fifth star. 

Crowd was actually pretty mixed which I genuinely appreciated. 

Good place to meet up with folks you actually want to talk to...
author: Miel H.

description:
Stumbled upon this place a few weeks ago while in town visiting, and was pretty glad. Me and the bf were looking for a low-key bar to just chill at after walking up and down hills all day long, and this met our criteria just fine. 

Cheap beer? Check.

Good music? Check.

Bartender making us shots from a random recipe my bf's friend texted him and not being annoyed by this? Check.

We had a good time hanging out here, and if I ever found myself in SF again, I would definitely come back.
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
Dr. G and I have many things in common: an antipathy toward holidays, a disdain for seasonal revelry, and a love of bars: the divier, the better. 
 
This is how I know that Dalva is open on Thanksgiving. You guessed it, we ended up there.

Dalva would be a worthy drinking hole even if options were not limited. It's hipster without trying too hard; divey without being depressing; and the drinks are served up by a friendly, extremely competent bartender. 

I started off with the hot toddy "du jour", a fresh-raspberry take on the lemon-brandy concoction, due to a persistent chesty cough I can't quite kick (Dr. G assures me it is not T.B.).  It was nice, although it was less hot toddy than hot jello (evoking not-so-fond memories of high school parties, but let's not digress).

After a well-priced beer or two, Dr. G had an extra dirty Grey Goose vodka martini on the rocks, served in a remarkably sturdy tumbler with heaps of ice and some skewered pickled olives. Heaven in a glass. Or at least a lot of vodka in a glass. 

In keeping with the brandy theme, I had a v respectable sidecar. Then, too hammered to care about thematic consistency, I switched to wine (for those of you keeping track at home, this is where the night went wrong). Don't get me wrong: the pours were respectable, and the tastes were complimentary. But sweet baby Jesus, was this wine awful.  Each and every red they served was ghastly. 

But you know, when the service is this sweet, and a bar is willing to open its doors and embrace you at 7 pm on Thanksgiving, and the D.J. obviously cut his turkey dinner short to come spin very cool old-school hip hop for us, I can't complain.

I really can't.

Happy holidays.
author: Kathleen G.

description: i think I remember this bar. Which probably means I had a good time.
author: Nikki M.

description:
This review will go straight to the point. Five stars for one reason: comparative advantage of restroom sanity over surrounding dives.

That and the yellow wall.
author: John H.

description:
Came with here with a childhood friend. The beer was good (some ultra micro brews). They were playing Sin City on the projector. They only take cash, so load up first. Otherwise, there is a bank machine outside. 

Good after work place. 

Thanks
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Went here last week. Would've written a review a lot sooner but I totally forgot i went. Which is a good thing. It's all a blur. 

But I do remember actually being able to just chill and let the music absorb into your buzzed out body. 

It was a little too loud in there to talk... that's probably the only downside to this place. I didn't use the bathrooms, so I don' t know what they're like.  

Unfortunately, they only take cash which really sucks, but they have an ATM. That $2 charge hurts though. UPGRADE TO PLASTIC PLEASE.

You know, I just really like bars that aren't flooded, I mean FLOODED with people. I could actually move here. 

The drinks were pretty good too... it's been a while since I've had a bubbly tom collins ;)
author: Eugenia Y.

description:
Stopped in last night while on our "bar crawl" in the Mission and was pleasantly surprised. 

While its kinda a small bar, they have a great selection of beverages. Good variety of local beers and other beer-like beverages and a full bar. 

I also appreciated the not totally disgusting bathroom that actually didn't have much of a smell. Hey sometimes bar bathrooms are some sort of evil hell hole you never hope to go in again and others aren't so bad. This one was not too bad :) 

Definitely think that if we are in the neighborhood again we will be stopping by
author: Erin B.

description:
A great bar.  An early SF favorite (along with the now-departed, but still mourned, Dr. Bombay's) (I was a huge Bewitched fan, and the best compliment I ever got was when someone told me I kind of looked like Samantha, but she was a close friend, and sort of drunk, so it didn't count, and I know that).  Dr. Bombay's was the laid-back spot, and Dalva's is what we thought was cool and hip, and I still think it is.

Update 5/30/07:

so in my day (not so long ago), there were white votive candles stretching down the bar.  Today, they were red. Yet . .  . what's not to like about a bar with fresh-squeezed juices.  Grapefruit is one of my mixer juices, and a bar that does fresh squeezed remains a bar for me. Add to that my continued affection for Dalva.  It's great.  Would be super great with white votives (and not those red things), but hey.  Super great is a rare thing.
author: Laurel B.

description: Good happy hour, cool layout. Kind of a mellower version of skylark down the street. Been here for happy hour several times, it is a good alternative to places downtown, where you can chill out, have a conversation, and relax.
author: Jim B.

description:
Yep, so my friends were in town and having a get-together at Dalva. Somehow, it being their first time at Dalva, they found the oh-so-obscure back room and secured a table there. So I spent about ten minutes in the front area, which is how long it took to greet my friends, take a seat at the bar, order beers (reasonably priced I guess), get my card denied because they only take cash, go to their little ATM, get cash, and pay. It was dark and pretty subdued, but a goodly crowd and people chatting.

The back was also dark and had an irie vibe going on. It was nice to have our table and feel a bit like an island unto ourselves, but also to still have the atmosphere of the whole bar looming around, which is what people really seek when they go to a bar, right? You could just drink a six-pack at home if it was just about the alcohol, but it's also about the atmosphere. 

So, yep, it was pretty good. Afterward I got on my bike and zoomed home.
author: U L.

description:
Dalva is great when it's laid-back. The backroom is a great place to get together with friends, esp. if those friends smoke. The drinks are yummy. The music is great. 

I don't like it so much when it gets super crowded on the weekends though. It has the problem that all narrow long bars have, you end up having to push your way through.
author: Jen M.

description: This bar is awesome! Have a drink in te main bar for a bit and then head to the hideout in back... Ask Josh for a drink  (amazing bartender) and then go up to the 2nd story and chill!!! (you can even reserve the upstairs for a private party... for FREE). Definitely check this place out!
author: Joel W.

description:
You all have done this unless you live in the immediate area and even then only if you live like within 2 -3 blocks.

You go to Delerium, Amnesia, Casanova or Doc's Clocks.  Then every time you go through the Mission, each bar you see, you're thinking "Oh, yeah, just another Dive Bar."  Then you pretty much assume everything is the same bar, different name or at least I did this for Skylark before realizing I was right.

Dalva, however I find to be quite a decent place.  For one, it isn't a dive.  Yeah it has dive prices but the bar actually looks pretty nice and the seating isn't bad.  The low lights make it a decent bar for a date or even a good place to meet with a group of friends. 

The beers are good too.  The one that stands out the most is that they have Hennepin from the Ommegang Brewery (which specializes in Belgain style beers) for like $4.  I'd probably be able to remember a lot more if I wouldn't have had those shots of Jameson.

One star off because transporting a round of drinks from the bar to the back area can be a nightmare on a crowded night but otherwise I'm definitely coming back.
author: Steven R.

description: LOVE this bar! The atmosphere is fantastic, the crowd is fun and the drinks are fantastic.  Go to the back room for sure for the really good cocktails, even though the wait is a bit long sometimes. My friends and I usually get drinks and go upstairs to upper room, its quieter so we can have a real conversation, but you still get the Dalva vibe with the lighting and music.  I can't imagine going out in the mission without going here.
author: Tessa S.

description:
Eh...Meh...Yeah...

It's not a bad decor.  I like to think of it as a lessor version of Skylark.  Dark, divey-ish but not super divey.  Bathroom in the back that's scary, but that's to be expected of any place in the Mission.  

The problems are crappy drinks, weird beer selection, and not so friendly barkeeps.  I might come back, but there are soooo many places I'd rather try first.
author: John H.

description:
Been here once with two girlfriends around 7 or 8ish, already hopping even then. Bartender was unbelievably nice, we ordered reasonably-priced beers from their respectable list of draft beer. 

Sat at the bar - this is the kind of place to come with one or two friends or maybe on a date, not so good for groups of people. Dim lighting, clean and cozy interior. 

Good location (in the Mission), we came here after an event at Needles & Pens and before hopping on BART. I'd be interested to come here later at night next time.
author: Devora Z.

description: What they lack in atmosphere they make up for in beer and free goldfish crackers. It's kind of amazing that they offer up $3 pints on HH that just so happens to include Lost Abbey's Devotion. Let me preface it as I've never seen Lost Abbey on tap anywhere, let alone for only $3, so this is a win-win situation. It would be cool if they re-painted or put up more decor, its a little bland-rental house in mexico feeling. I need to check out the Hideout after 8pm for a better vibe.
author: Cori W.

description:
Dear Dalva,

Do you know how thin those walls are? I know you have music to play, people to entertain. BUT there are some people who are trying to enjoy independent films at Roxie Cinema next door as well. 

I was watching a Japanese indie film in the theatre - very emotional and beautifully shot film - and all I could hear was "thump, thump, thump, thump," the silly repetitious beats from the bar. It ruined my mood and movie experience. 

Be nice to neighborhood businesses, please.
author: Tomo B.

description: Such a fun, chill bar with great music (from Guns 'n' Roses to Gladys Knight).  And they let you eat your food from Truly Mediterranean!
author: Wendy L.

description:
walking into dalva was like having someone wrap me in a chenille throw. shhh shhh. and off i go to my happy place after two days in the car with my family.  

the bartender here knows how to keep a bar.  his set up was impeccable.  an array of sliced mandarines and limes just waiting to be squeezed into a mojito, a lively bunch of mint upright in a glass of water, a pitcher of sanguine sangria and an absinthe dispenser replete with spoons.  such a drinking environment demands that i jump up and scream OUTRAGEOUS!
author: Jordan V.

description:
I went on a Saturday night around 9:30 for a friend's birthday-- we set up shop in the 1st floor back room-- and it was great!

The prices of drinks were plenty reasonable-- I got 2 domestic pints, and a standard well drink for $13. For the mission, that's not too bad. I love that you can either go out into the crowded bar and have a good time, or go into the back rooms and be able to chit chat without screaming. Definitely will go again.

Also, the music being played (I didn't see a DJ...) was a plus. I'm sure their jukebox during the week is good too.
author: maranda w.

description: Super-Friendly bartenders with mixology savvy that serve up tasty concoctions.
author: Scott M.

description:
Dalva has the best jukebox in the city...morcheeba, st. etienne, thievery... and it just has a totally laid back chill atmosphere.  They also make a killer (seriously, drinking too many of these will kill you) Caipirinha.  It totally pisses them off if you order too many though cuz they're a bitch to make.  oh! added bonus is that they have these little hooks on the wall under the tables in the back so that you can hang up your purse...sweet.  

Bathroom situation: sucks on a super busy night, but usually serviceable and for some reason the men think it's okay to migrate over to the women's bathroom and piss all over the floor.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
3.5  stars really.

Another fun dive bar.

Good DJ, cheap drinks. Dark everywhere, crowded.  Fun.  Serves sangria which made me happy.  Mixed crowd.  Super casual.  Jukebox plays when DJ isn't there.  Back room is good if you want to not have to scream above the DJ, we moved back there when the DJ got there.  Good place to meet friends.  Probably not a place to meet your next one night stand though, everyone seemed to really be there to hang out with each other, not to get laid.  

My second sangria though was warm.  Or maybe I was too busy talking to drink it and it got warm.
author: Denise B.

description: found this place thank to my yelp fam! cool gem in the heart of the mission. i especially love the secret romantic hideout on the second floor. definitely sets the right mood and is just nice to be tucked away from the flood of mission hipsters downstairs. good drinks too! i'll be back :)
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I've been to Dalva twice, once in the late evening with co-workers for after-party drinks, the second time in the late afternoon with a group who I went on an skydiving outing with.

At late night, it can be difficult to hear conversations in a large group, whereas during the day, the acoustics are fine.

The prices for drinks are inexpensive, so whether you're getting a pitcher of sangria to share, or pints for yourself, it's worth stopping by for a drink or to hang out a bit longer.
author: Lloyd C.

description:
Since I live in the TL I tend to frequent MY local bars more than I do these Mission bars.  I feel like an outsider...even though they are still pretty walkable from where I live.  Therefore I don't ever feel all that "at home" here.  I feel like a tourist.  

This place is very very dark, which I normally like (in chic bars) because you know it's probably clean. (even though you can't see crap)  But in Dalva the tables are sticky and wooden.  God knows what the floor is like, it's too damn dark to see anything!   It's nice to go to Dalva when waiting for your movie to start...and I guess that's all I really know about it.

Oh yah, and the backroom is a "smoking room" and freakin' FREEZING.   Buuurrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr.
author: Mary R.

description: I think the single $ is wrong, I would give this place $$. But the cocktails were absolutely fabulous, and I love sitting upstairs in the quieter and roomier benches. Also the music, which that night was the bartenders iPod!, was really wonderful. I'll be back for sure.
author: Alexandria N.

description:
When mission hipsters grow up they go to Dalva... I really like it here. No music really, but they play great movies on the screen. Bar tenders are pretty attentive. 

I would much rather spend my night at Dalva then Double Dutch, Kilowat, Delerium, Elbow Room.... etc. etc. etc.
author: danny e.

description: Super cheap drinks: 3 bucks for a beer on Saturday afternoon.
author: Danny C.

description:
Uncomfortably narrow...to match the uncomfortably narrow minded people I met there.

This looks like a bar that most people might have a good time at.  I just had an unfortunate experience here.
author: Margaux S.

description:
This place is completely overpriced!

The only thing that makes this place decent is the smoking they allow you to do in the back and the grimey dive bar regulars who don't belong in this place hanging out there, their cool!

The wanna be pretend hipsters or whatever they are hanging out at the bar I could do without!
author: Jason K.

description:
Funny thing, aging. It still surprises me how, as I get older, I find that things I used to believe so passionately turn out to be--without finding a more graceful term--wrong.

Where at one point in my life (a time, no doubt, speckled with nights shutting down such glorious locales as Molotov's and Kilowatt) I derided Dalva for a bartender's use of Flair. And, while Flair itself is not particularly cool (see: the opposite), the employment of bottle tossing by one bartender is hardly a fair measure of the establishment.

The truth is, Dalva is kinda great. They have a really fantastic beer selection, and good draft specials on a regular basis. Also, the "Hideout" in the back (when open) makes good cocktails. I literally had no idea it existed for years.

Easily my second favorite bar on the street, after the Monk's Kettle, and if you don't feel like waiting two hours on a Friday to get a beer, it rises to the #1 spot quickly.
author: Aiden B.

description:
Dalva is a great place to catch up with your friend who is a total square and would take you somewhere totally lame if they could.  You would much rather be at the Kilowatt, but you know you totally can't talk in there, and besides it would only depress you that you can't get shitty drunk and have safaris anymore. 

Dalva's that elusive middle ground between degenerate and douchebag.   Refreshingly mellow in the sea of irritation that is 16th street.
author: Coco D.

description:
I blame Dalva for my getting 'sneak attack' drunk last Friday night. 

You know the feeling - you're stone cold sober all night (though you've been drinking for hours and don't want to tell yourself that you're not drunk yet because, well, you may be an alcoholic and your tolerance is astronomical), until you walk in the door to your apartment and BLAM - you're hammered. 

From what I can pinpoint, I'm going to blame the ridiculously strong makers & gingers I was throwing back at Dalva at the end of the night for my subsequent shower stumble and the remarkably deep scratch I imparted on my own ankle during said shower.

While sneak attack isn't the most fun of all varieties of drunk, at  least you'll probably make it home with all your belongings - always the mark of a good night.

FYI - Cash only!
author: Carla C.

description:
I love the drinks here. The pimlico, brilliant!  But this place gets off the hook busy. Like, you can't move busy. I mean it is a long hallway of a place, but it gets too packed. Smoking back room, not that great. I mean it's cool to have a group back there and you all smoke and that's agreed upon. But it gets downright hazy back there. Come out smelling like a prisoner who's in lock down and all he (or she) has is a carton of Kools to pass the time with. Stanky!
But that being said the drinks- again they are great. They also show good movies sometimes.
author: shannon t.

description: Great small neighborhood bar. Wish they had a better Dj line-up!
author: Jonathan S.

description:
the back room was the best...situated right under the stairs and far enough from the front bar that you don't get to hear everyone's drunk ass banter.  

it's one of the few places in the city you can still smoke in the back. it's sort of a tacit agreement that's understood among vets and locals.  you could sometimes have a conversation back here and not be bothered by others.  i haven't been back in a few years, but when i go home i'll be sure to revisit and check out what's changed.  

from what i remember the drinks were strong but around $7 for a cocktail.  it's okay.  i only go for company anyways not for drinks.
author: Crista Y.

description: Call me hipster, call me trendy, but this place was a bit alternative for me. They were playing random videos, no music. Nice place to just catch up with friends w/o all the background music. Good old Truman Pilsner beer. Affordable.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Wait, was there a back room where you can smoke cigs? I vaguely remember all this from my drunken state. Surprisingly, I only just remembered it this second. hmmmm, interesting.

From what I remember I really like Dalva. The bartender was nice, from what I remember. The space was nice, from what I remember. The crowd was cool, from what I remember. I had a lot of fun, from what I remember. If I could remember this much, it had to be kinda good.
author: Bobby P.

description:
Dalva could be an extension of my living room. It's dark, comfortable, and great for conversation (on weeknights, of course).  

There's a film projection wall, which is part entertaining, part cliche. It's pretty standard that at some point while you're at Dalva, your conversation trails off when you and your drinking buddy get distracted by an odd Fellini-esque scene involving a clown, a gun and an umbrella. But no matter. 

Even when it's packed, Dalva is a nice change from some of the madness you encounter on 16th Street.
author: Jill C.

description:
Ahhh Dalva, dark, daring, & definitely a cool hang out spot! Thumbs up for the dimly lit ambiance & old school B&W movies on the screen in the back. 

Situated in the popular Valencia & 16th area, it was a nice little spot to stop by and have a drink. Lovely wall with a list of drinks to choose from...My friend & I were definitely amused by the drink names cut out in pieces of paper & taped to the board, nice touch! A good selection of beers, mixed drinks, & sangria! We were saved by indulging in some Sierra Nevada! 

Bartender was nice, and helped us right away. I believe this place gets crowded on weekend nights. We luckily went early, and grabbed the tall table & chairs on the side wall. Bathroom was mediocre, and fairly clean. 

A DJ was spinning some mixes up front, so if you like loud music to enjoy with some drinks...dive on over to Dalva!  Plus bart is only a couple blocks away.
author: Catherine O.

description: Awesome chimpanzee films screening on the back wall. Super cool '60's groove tunes. AMAZING bourbon drinks (go with the bourbon rouge or the rattlesnake - you'll love both). Really cool bartender. I thought about giving this place four stars, but I really couldn't figure out why I was hijacking the fifth star, so there you have it. I don't know what it's like on a Friday or Saturday night, but it's a perfect chill place for a mellow Sunday evening cocktail.
author: Kate S.

description: Accompanied my coz and friends to this place - it was a riot.  For a while, I could not see what was going on, quite dark in there.  The Girls' restroom was hidden behind the DJ - it was like having to walk into a restroom on a stage. Had the Grapefruit Soda cocktail at the HideOut which took half an hour.
author: J S.

description:
Dimly lit, drinks are ok and I swear, they play the Strokes on the jukebox every time I'm there.
Good happy hours, your typical divey Mission bar, good place to start the night out, but not an all night hang.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Here's the short and sweet run-down on Dalva (keeping in mind I went during happy hour).  Their drink prices were good.  They served perfect tasting vodka tonics that still managed to hit me like a runaway truck.  And the back room is a Yelper Paradise, maybe even better than Danny Coyle's upper level seating.

The only downside, really, was that it's your standard Mission District shoebox joint.  People were stacked two-deep table side and three-deep bar side, and trying to get through wasn't always easy.  So, -1 star there, but Dalva is still a great place to grab a drink with friends.
author: Adam W.

description:
There's absolutely nothing wrong with this bar, but there's nothing particularly remarkable about it either.  It's one of those narrow tunnel bars with nice moody lighting and orange, textured walls that are exactly like the ones in my parents' living room.  There's a particularly nice little room in the back but alas, it was reserved for a private party.  Also, props for having a DJ that played music I could still talk over.

Certainly an essential stop if you're doing a 16th St bar crawl, but it probably won't be the one that stands out in your memory the next morning.
author: Wes M.

description:
After nearly a decade, I finally got to live out my vicarious Third Eye Blind lyrical fantasy!  Okay, so that's a meaningless abstraction, but it was nifty to not only go to the bar that they made famous, but to thoroughly enjoy it.  Judging by some of the crazy stories here, it was probably helpful that I went at about 5:30 in the afternoon, when the sun was out, the crowd was light and orderly, and the service was fast.

I met high school comrade Mia L. (from those heady Third Eye Blind days) and savored a delicately prepared Bloody Mary.  There are some bartenders who just can't be bothered to give the proper attention that a Bloody Mary required, and the gentleman behind the bar at Dalva went above and beyond, and was not fussy about it at all.  That alone earns five stars (even if it might have been a different story at midnight or so).
author: Matthew M.

description:
So ..... this place has been here for something like 15 years and was in the ranks of the other 549 out of 1187 bars in the mission I have yet to visit. 
Well ... 550 down ... 637 to go!!! 
Did I mention this place kind of rules? 
They serve some nice whiskey cocktails ... they have a really cool dark back area to get your chill on.
I would say more .. but you should just go there.
Right next to BART as well for meet ups.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I liked this place. It as laid back and low key.  The bar tenders were helpful but its was so lound inside that they couldnt hear  the drink orders. So they screwed up my drink. I was not quite happy about it .. but i guess shit happens.

They had some weird movie playing .. which was so baddddd the it was weirdly entertaining ...  I am not so sure about this place. I think with the right company this place could be fun.
author: Amlan S.

description:
This place is hit or miss when it comes to the music. I've been in there when the night began with Joy Division and The Smiths, and ended with horrible top 40. 
Great atmosphere, a narrow long bar with a movie screen in the back usually playing some obscure 1970's film. The drink prices wont break the bank either. 
I was there a few times before I discovered the more intimate two floor "back area" that almost  has the feel of a party at someones house.
author: Crystal R.

description:
Went here yesterday for my weekly Thirsty Thursday with friends, and it was a grand time. Walked over from BART to find a decently sized crowd for a rainy Thursday. Found my friends in the cozy back room, and the bartender quickly served me up a Maker's, neat. 

All in all, this is a prototypical "solid" bar. It's nothing flashy, but it's easy to get to, serves cheap drinks, it's not dirty and has a normal crowd of people around. Big ups for being close to late night food.
author: Bryan T.

description:
Yeah, I dig it.  

I don't do many bar trips to the mission but this place fits my taste just fine, if not perfectly.

dig it.
author: Sarah K.

description:
All I know is some old Paul Newman movie was on the screen, classic soul was playing on the sound system, and I was downing Red Stripe's like Jamaica was about to go the way of Atlantis.  Oh yeah, bartenders were pretty friendly too.

Minus one star because the men's bathroom looks like a scene from the horror flick "Candy Man".
author: J. O.

description: Great back room for upscale cocktails. Room is nicely done, built by one of the owners who occasionally bartends. Crowd can be much out front at times. Over all very cool place. Wish they saved the old mural from the previous incarnation "Shumiko's", was way cool.
author: Robert P.

description: Nice vibe... kinda divey but not too divey.  Also the backroom is the star here.  Good selections of drinks, and I have a soft spot in my heart for any place that serves Barbancourt 5 star rum as a drink.
author: Brian A.

description:
Great atmosphere, great music (whether on the jukebox or resident DJ) and your typical great SF selection of beers. Love the room in back for more intimate chillin out (you can *get away with* smoking back there too, shhh....) If you choose to sit out front, they'll most likely be projecting a movie on the back wall (the likes of Top Gun, 2001, Enter the Dragon...)
More for the chill-mode portion of the night.
author: Marty K.

description:
Since moving to this part of town I tend to go here allot. There is something about this place that I am drawn to.The music, the darkness, the movies playing, the high tables, the cheap drinks....everything. 

AB
author: Anthony B.

description: Very laid back. Came a little earlier than 9pm on a Friday to catch a DJ and it was full already... The price was right on all the drinks. Had lots of yummy sangrias. I guess I'm used to paying $10+ on watered down gin and tonics at most clubs in SF. But then again this is a dive and paying $5 for gin coming from a plastic bottle isn't that great either. I recommend this place for hanging out if you're nearby already, but I don't think it's anything special. A big plus for the cool way they melt sugar to make an Absinthe! Also the bartenders are really cool and nice.
author: Leily P.

description: Been here many, many times when I lived in the area. Celebrated a New Year's here as well. My best advice: go on a weeknight & avoid busy crowds as this place can get packed (& smelly). Thursdays are great nights because you can actually go w/ a group of folks, get a beer & sit back & relax w/ good conversation without the never ending round of "what?" no I said "what?" The back feels like a little cove which makes it perfect for conversation.
author: Ashlee F.

description: Can get pretty crowded but I love this bar. It's been around forever and hasn't lost its appeal or charm. The back room is the best if you can get a table. Order yourself a ginger beer & vodka!
author: Caitlin R.

description: Awesome dark bar with an even darker back room that is absolutely perfect for under-the-table shenanigans, if you catch my drift.  Fairly decent sangria  and cheapish drinks.  Too bad BLOWholes occasionally hog the bathroom.
author: Kate M.

description:
Dalva gets 4 stars mainly because they can actually make a good Cosmo (surprising for a dive bar) at dive bar prices and the location is centrally located near 16th & Valencia with all the other bars/restaurants.

Interior is typical dive bar, dark, grungy.  The skinny space along the bar can get too crowded but there is more space and stools in the back to mingle with a large group of friends.  Great pit stop on a bar crawl or to grab a drink, though not exciting enough to hang around for much more than that.
author: Chris P.

description:
The Sangria will knock your socks off....as well as you off your barstool....and very effective.  :)

Unpretentious place, but loud and crowded as the evening wears on....or were my ears just ringing 'cause of the Sangria???
author: ser s.

description: Excellent low key just skating above a dive bar bar.. Have a pint or two, stay a while and make your way to the back for the excellent whiskey bar hidden in the back of this almost dive bar bar, The Hideout is hidden, hide, get lost, get found, find the booze yee admire the most. Get to it. Ahora!
author: Gregory H.

description:
I'm writing a review today because I am headed to Dalva in a few minutes. Review writing is what I do when I'm wasting time and am waiting for bars to open.

I like Dalva the best right when it opens, on a week night. There aren't many people there and I can stretch out and prop my feet on either stool, spin around in circles and leave my crap on the floor.The weekends tend to be pretty crowded and that wee little walkway to the back can be tiresome to plow through when carrying drinks (or giant pizzas).

I really appreciate the delicate lighting that emanates from the walls, as if we are in one giant confessional and there are voyeuristic priests peering at us through the lattice, watching us commit sin after beautiful sin.

The projected movies are a good distraction and/or conversation starter when your company isn't fulfilling your needs. And they have Death and Taxes Black beer on tap by Moonlight brewery, one of my current faves.

Kind of classy, kind of divey and so far no signs of pretentious behavior or hipster take-over.
author: Zara E.

description:
It was the San Francisco bar I experienced when on my preliminary trip-out here.  And since I've moved and been around for longer now, I still go to Dalva and love it.  

Love the movies playin, love the atmosphere and the kind of people that hang here (not necessarily on the weekends).  I usually drink beer here, so I can't really say what the mixed drinks are like, but the beer selections pretty good.  

My only complaint is when I have been here on the weekend, hangin with a friend and the music gets progressively louder, almost to epic proportions until we're screaming at each other through the beats.  To me, it just isn't the dancey kind of bar, it's the chill the eff out, enjoy some friends and drinks so loud loud music is kind of resented.  But other than that, dig it!
author: April B.

description:
We are bunch of writers that liked to smoke in the back. We came here every other weekend for the last two years.

We laughed, we cried, we danced. I like this place.
author: Sprout S.

description:
One of the first I ever came to in SF. I think it instantly became my favorite bar. From the wall sconces to the movie projector to the tiny side tables to the backroom. Just wow.
And it never is packed. Ever. When I go.
author: Matt L.

description:
Dalva may look a little too "marina-esque" for the mission district, but it's really not so out of touch with the neighborhood as that.  Really, it's more "artsy-fartsy" than anything else, as alot of the clientele consists of cinema and photography students from SF State who are hanging out before/after seeing a flick at the Roxy next door.

The atmosphere is pretty chill, with dim candle-lighting, high tables lining the wall and interesting artwork reaching up to the exta-high ceilings.  There's also a cozy lounge-type room in the back.

Overall, as far as bars to hang out at,  I prefer other places in the area, as Dalva's a little too noisy for a conversation and the seating is somewhat uncomfortable, but it is an ok spot to go if you're killing time before going to the Roxy.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Sure, it can become a little crowded on weekends from time to time, but for quite a bit of the week it's just a nice little spot to stick yourself into for awhile. Probably about fifteen feet wide and possessing about 2 lightbulbs, it's a great little bar stuck right in the middle of a neighborhood full of trendy hipster joints that seem to be constantly looking for a way to jam another 50 people into them.

Service is super friendly, drinks made with appropriate care, and the music selection, whether it's from the 'esoteric' jukebox or played from behind the bar, is some of the best in the entire city.

So if you're in the mood for somewhere 'not so big', give Dalva a shot. It's not exactly 4 floors of kickin' DJs, but sometimes, that's a really good thing.
author: Andrew L.

description:
One of my Old Favorite places to end the night in the City.  Great Music either from the Juke Box or being spun by the DJ.

This has to be one of the best dive bars around.  Great drinks at a very cheap price.  Definitely recommended for groups.
author: Gurdeep J.

description:
This has been my favorite bar for years!

The best part is probably the juke box; it's got an awesome variety of music when there isn't a dj spinning.  For some reason, I like that there's not a dance floor, too.  Keeps it just a bar, I guess.

They have a full bar, including my fave Grey Goose, and their signature sangria, too.  

I always meet kool kats at this place, there is never a cover and whenever I'm in the Mission I hit this spot at some point in the night, usually earlier.
author: Drea M.

description: Uncomfortably shaped seating area isn't really conducive to large groups, and the well tequila leaves you with a hangover that lasts for days...  But if you are the type who doesn't let a simple brain-splitting headache mess with your day, they happy hour is cheap enough to make it a nice reasonable place to start a Mission pub-crawl.
author: Mason G.
Drue C.

description: Dalva is a hecka moist bar, yo.  They have real bartenders who give you an approving look when you order an old fashioned and sneer at you when you order a whiskey sour.
author: Christopher K.

description: Dalva is a great place to start an evening of debauchery.  Inexpensive drinks, cool music and seats at the bar even on a Friday night around 10pm.  Bartenders were friendly and drinks strong.  Thanks Dalva, I'll be back.
author: phil h.

description: I like Dalva, I can't say it's one of my favorite bars in the Misson but I like it alright. They have Franziskaner on tap and that makes me happy. Especially when I order it in Sean Connery's voice and the bartender "gets" me. Yeah it's not the cheapest, they actually charge $4.50, which kinda drives me crazy, what am I supposed to do with $0.50 change at a bar?  Anyhoo, my friends seem to really like this place and it's a good alternative on a Friday night once Cassanova is spilling into the streets, the music at Skylark is no longer tolerable and there's nothing but frat boys at Killowatt.
author: Frigga G.

description: Fun bar in the heart of the mission. Very friendly bartenders and always something fun playing behind the bar. Old school Donald duck anyone? Drink are affordable and there is Karaoke on Sundays. All and all a fun time.
author: Marissa P.

description: Typical Mission bar.  Average drinks, dark, kinda sticky feel, narrow space, and crowded.  I wouldn't go back.   There is a back bar and room and an upstairs room, so if you have a large group, it could be a good place to hang out.
author: Kari L.

description:
You know the night's off to a good start when you walk into a bar and hear some Bill Withers playing.  Well, for me anyways cuz I love me some Bill Withers.  
I'm just not a bar girl no matter how hard I try though.  I'm definitely a blow girl and the minute they start serving that at a bar I will NEVER miss a Happy Hour.  However, that is still not the case so I tried to hang with the peeps over a drink at Dalva.  Unfortunately, my drink wasn't great.  I had something with mint in it that wasn't a mojito and while I was initially impressed with the use of fresh mint I quickly realized that it was irritating as I was unable to drink my drink without sucking a friggin' leaf into my straw.  Yuck.  Also not fond of the whole cash only bar thing either.  Granted, I'm not likely to open a huge tab but it's nice to not have to always have cash on hand.  Especially in the Mission.  Not a bad bar otherwise but not something I'm likely to fall head over heels for either.
author: Jill D.

description:
the criteria by which i assess whether or not i like a bar and then how many stars i'm going to assign to it is random and inconsistent, at best. i love bars where drinks are cheap, but then begrudge them the hangovers i nurse the next day. five stars for drinks! no stars for this hangover! plus star for cute boy! minus star for the bacon dog i ate afterwards! (bacon dogs get five stars on their own, however.)

dalva is one of those bars that i like, but not overly. nothing stands out for me, except the steve mcqueen movies they play, which i really like because they give me an excuse to ignore gross men who try to talk to me, and really, i think EVERY bar should have something like that, an escape route for women, and that it doesn't deserve anything like four or five stars just for providing it in the form of steve mcqueen.
author: Irene S.

description: Aside from the great drinks and relaxed, down-to-earth atmosphere... I lost my wallet here Friday night and someone found it and left it with the bartender! Over $200 still in it! How awesome it that? LOVE DALVA!! =)
author: Veronica R.

description: Old New Orleans bf of mine called this "the only New Orleans bar in SF" and I think he's right, though I don't have the credentials to claim that... it's long and narrow with neat artwork. Tall seats, and a local crowd. It's one of the few places in the intermission gultch that attract neighbors, but is still super cool and not divey. Late at night before closing I'd run into my favorite neighbor. Have I beated that point into you yet? Neighborhood bar! haha. Interesting poeple. I remember when it was a short-lived dyke bar. The DJ is unobtrusive, usually. I was in there on an afternoon and there was an earthquake. My favorite online-date place. Kissed a British guy in the backroom, kissed another guy in the hallway. I'm a kissing machine. If you know about the upstairs in the back you will get some street cred.
author: Anna B.

description: I've been going here for years and love the dark, candle lit, classic movie always running in the background atmosphere. My friends liked the smoking room in the back, but I really like what they've done with the new upscale back bar and liquor selection. Impressive. If you haven't been in a while, go check it out.
author: Corey V.

description: Like many bars, it's a ghost town midweek, but it wasn't too packed on a Saturday night--we easily scored some seats.  The black and white film playing on the screen looked entertaining, though, I didn't pay much attention to it.  I especially liked the music the DJ was spinning that night.  One of the bartenders seemed kinda douchey.  Begin or end your libations here.
author: Marsha Z.

description: A pretty generic Mission bar really.  The back room can be nice when you get some friends together, but all in all there's not much that makes this bar stand out from the rest of the alternatives in the area.  The drink/beer selection is average, the prices are average, the crowd is average mission hipster types, the bar staff are average, and the jukebox selection sucks.  It doesn't help that Kilowatt is across the street either.  I can think of no real reason to avoid this place, but why you'd opt to come here instead of Kilowatt or even Cassanova is beyond me.
author: Joshua W.

description: This is a great spot in the middle of alot of very crowded bars. Maybe it's more crowded during the weekends but the monday I was there it was great. Back room for lounging, tecate on tap, and good cocktails as well. Old funk on the jukebox, and old movies on a big screen. Like my friend said "not filled with alot of people in your face". A hidden weekday gem, so if you have not been, try to keep it on the down low.
author: Julian M.

description: I like Dalva for meeting up with friends, and for happy hour, but not as a destination on a night out. They tend to have some really cool DJs though.
author: Nish N.

description: 80% douchebag-free most nights. One of the best saloons in the area. Drinks are strong and fairly priced. Jukebox tries a bit too hard to be esoteric (drunks don't need the challenge), but most bars could care less about how mediocre their jukes are. So bravo for trying, actually.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
just another hipster bar on 16th and valencia. ho-hum. well, at least the drinks are pretty cheap and the vibe is mellow on weeknights and unlike its neighbor delirium, the bathroom is clean. so that's a plus. other than that, there's really nothing special about dalva.

on weekends i do my best to avoid dalva and so should you, unless you want an easy hook-up with a hipster. then dalva is an excellent place to go. you can thank me later. oh, and pack a condom or two... ok, i'm in a serious relationship. so i don't know anything about hooking up, especially with a hipster. however, that's what many of my friends say about dalva. so if you fail miserably at dalva, let me know and i'll remove the hook-up reference. good luck.
author: frisco j.

description: Favorite Mission bar past 2 years.  Why are they always showing some random John Waters film whenever I come here?  Awesome jukebox.  People here are cool as fuck and tenders are nice and generous with their pours. HEEHEEHEE. I love Dalva!
author: Joyhan S.

description: I love this bar.  Have loved it since before I moved to San Francisco 8 years ago.  I like its dark ambience and candle-glow warmth thus making it great for weeknight dates.  (too crowded on the weekends like most bars.)  It's the kind of bar that leads me to drinking too many cocktails and sneaking a ciggie.
author: darla s.

description: The vibe is good.  I am unhip enough that the jukebox is about 70% artists that I have never heard of...that's not the say that the music isn't good.  Quite the opposite.
author: T-Bone L.

description: Very laid back, Dalva knows what it's doing when it comes to the 1st couple drinks of the night. The screen shows old school films that you can gaze at when the conversation dulls and there is a fair amount of seating -- plus I love the back rooms for the occasional ciggy. I had a friend who booked the entire back area and had the best birthday of her life here so it's my plan to do the same in a couple years.
author: Jane K.

description: My favorite bar in the U.S. and sorely missed. One of the main reasons I'd like to move back to San Francisco and my favorite thing about the Mission. Dark, atmospheric, sexy, and alternately mellow or bumpin', with a superb jukebox to boot. Perfect drinks, especially when Erik is making them.  P.S. He owns the joint, so I recommend dropping the attitude, bitches -- you know who you are, Marina dudes.
author: D H.

description: Nice vibe, but not the best place for groups--loud and small. Good live DJ most nights, and the best part for me: a proper wine selection. They have nonstandard beers on tap as well. I love this sweet little Mission institution.
author: Gretchen T.

description: I really like it. Cozy with well-made cocktails and much better than average DJs.
author: patrick g.

description: Dark, hip and groovy tunes are what you'll get at this dive bar cum lounge. Get here early because their Happy Hour is legendary. A bonus is the jukebox (named Ophelia) is free during Happy Hour also!
author: Robin S.

description: I can only speak to Toph One's Wednesdays here.. An amazing, absurd, and utterly wonderful cast of characters, like a bizaro episode of cheers where Sam accidentally pours liquid acid into everyone's beers, and then someone starts playing records and then it's like that jitterbug scene that was cut from the wizard of oz.
author: Tal K.

description: Hadn't been here since our friend Brian moved to NYC about a year or so back.  still a cool spot, unpretentious and more of what DD is trying to be...
author: A P.

description: Dude, I totally forgot to write this up:  A few weeks ago I went here late-night with a buddy and while we were sipping our boutique beers in the corner of this semi-divey little hole in the wall, a guy came in with his girl, they sat down, got a couple drinks, and then the guy started dancing.  Not just jamming to the music either; the dancing resembled an odd mix between b-boying, techno head-banging, and the No-Rhythm dance.  This spectacle was so compelling that we had to order another round in order to keep observing.  And then the rest of their crew came in and they all left, so we left too.  But we'll be back.
author: Chuck W.

description:
Last night I went to Dalva because a friend of a friend told me that the DJ from Mr. Smiths was going to be there cuttin it up.  I got there around 10 and Toph (old school s.f. dj) was spinnin some nice downtempo selections. A little while later Jah Rocker (just learned his name) came on and played a set that in short  finger banged my brain. This dude was playin some jams that sounded like they should've come from a taco truck parked in outer space. Electro organic riddims real rich and thick.These were some of the baddest Cumbias and Reggae in Spanish jams being thrown down this side of the border. I was expecting to hear the rock hip hop thing he does on the weekend but when I heard Manu Chao mixed with The Luniz " I got 5 on it"  I was like" GAD DAMN this Vato (with dreads) iz the LICKS". The bartender was super friendly and poured my drinks like he owed me some money.SHEEEET SON. Rum with a splash of coke for color and lots o' lime. HMM HMM B!TCH. IT'LL GIT CHA DRUNK!! I hadn't been there for a couple of years so going back for the Red Wine Social and getting to hear two of S.F.'s more original DJ's was like getting my ears LAID for the very first time.

PS. They were playin actual VYNYL. You know, like pullin each record out of its sleeve to play it. AWWW LAWD.
author: santiago g.

description: Bonjour!  Je suis allez a Dalva ce soir.  J'aime beaucoup, c'est tres bien et, J'aime fume en le chambre.  I don't think I said anything there cause the last french class I had was sophmore year,  but WHATEVER, what i meant to say was:  Hello, I am going to Dalva tonight.  I like it a lot, it is very nice and I like to smoke in the room.  I meant the "back" but can't recall those words.  Like Amber, you can smoke here and when I am called upon to party with my friends of yesteryear, i.e. graduate school, I am required to smoke.  So we head here for a great scene with no discernable dorks and the smoking room.  Always seats in the back....until now that I've told you...doh!
author: Claire C.

description:
oh dalva, me love you long time. 

this is my favorite place to start a night out in the mission. it's dark, the music is loud, but not too loud, and if i get there before 9:30 i can always get a seat. the bartenders make strong no-nonsense drinks with fair prices. the only bummer is it's cash only. but there is an ATM. there's a pretty good mix of people, but the nice thing is no one really cares who else is there.
author: rachel p.

description: Great little bar near the corner of 16th and Valencia.  It's long, narrow, and dimly lit which encompass the good and bad of this place.  They have a great little room in the back with access to a small outside area.  The jukebox is unique so people will either love it, hate it, or be too drunk to care.  I loved it.  It did get very crowded and because of it's shape there were definitely moments when you had to be a bit forceful to get by.  Whenever you find yourself in those types of situations it's not uncommon for people to get rubbed the wrong way, figuratively and literally.  No one got bent out of shape the night I was there though.  This place is definitely on the list of bars that I can go to after work in Friday to have a few drinks.  The location is also prime for finding a place to eat when you need to take the edge off your buzz.
author: Luis M.

description: Damn, I didn't know they served food. I made my way to the back, nope, nothing. Walked upstairs, empty. Back downstairs the aroma of bacon was overwhelming. Wait, is that onions? I hope the bacon wrapped hot dog guy (from a few doors down) is kicking some down to dalva, because I had to find the source and once I did, no more dalva...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Love the ambiance.  It's a pretty small place but it's not too bad.  Drinks were good
author: Lily K.

description:
My friends seem to love this place because we keep going back here but I have to admit I just don't understand the allure other than it's dark and the music doesn't completely suck. The place is narrow and can be really hard to move around in. The bartenders seem to know their stuff and if you are a beer connesiour you'll love the selection in this place.

It took me a couple visits to realize if you go back towards the bathrooms there is a whole other room that is fairly spacious with tables and benches along the walls which makes it the only part of the bar good for groups.

Unfortunately, despite smoking in public buildings being illegal and a Frigging sign on the wall that says No Smoking it seems that all the smokers know about this back room and light up back there regardless of whether you give them dirty looks or not. If you're lucky you'll get some marijuana smokers back there also. If they kicked the smokers out, this place might get 4 stars.
author: Mike T.

description: Only had one drink here- was reasonably priced, bartender was nice- music was good... this place is in a great location if you're looking to bar hop. I'll go back and revise this review once I do, but for now I'm gonna have to say just 3/5...
author: Diane S.

description:
If my current life were a poker game, i'd be the straight with a handful of queens.  If the Miss Universe contest allowed men to participate, the group of ladies I associate with would be the first to grab their evening gowns and sign up.  So it goes.  
Last night I (yet again) went out with fairy-Matty and Slops, but this time our entourage also included Madame and Tiara J.  While they sipped their cosmos and raspberry vodka fruity drinks, I nursed bottles of PBR and soaked in the greatness of Dalva.  Now, we all know I hate the Mission...but this place almost, maybe, quite possibly could help me change my opinion.  Granted, I went on the last day of the long weekend around 9:30 so the place was dead, but the "DJ" was spinning some classics, Top Gun was playing on the big screen, and the darkness of this place just swallowed me up and made me feel right at home.  
But last night I realized that I need to find new friends.  I love my girls and all their sordid stories of sexual debauchery and butthole pleasures (homage to "40-year old virgin"), but when I make a comment about female, ahem, parts and the joys to be found therein, and am met by blank and slightly horrified stares, it's time for me to get a new hand of cards.  Or a girlfriend.
author: Zev K.

description: Tasty cocktails, not too packed on a Friday night, ample seating, dug the small tables. Would be good for a couple. Thought the shitty movie was a nice touch.
author: haley d.

description: one of my favorite mission bars. stylish, with dim, strategically-placed lights, this narrow bar usually has a mellow crowd (i.e. sans marina refugees and walnut creeksters) and great drink specials.
author: Art O.

description:
5 stars for the funny name.
p.s.  why does someone think this review was useful?
author: regina k.

description: Love Dalva.  Especially the dark hidden areas where you can hang and listen to cool beats.  Great low key go-to spot for meeting up with your peeps.
author: michelle s.

description: This place gets four stars based soley on the fact that when I was there, they were projecting the 1950s B film "The Women of Spider Island" onto the wall. Had I never gone to Dalva, I might never have seen this spectacular piece of cinema. The movie gets six stars. That's one more star than I'm actually allowed. That's how good it was. This review should technically be for the movie. But the drinks were good and it was dimly lit. So four stars for that buddy!
author: Elissa D.

description:
i am appending the appendix review.

honestly, i was three sheets to the wind when i wrote th crap below after spending about $20 worth on drinks at this glorious establishment. $20 will get you far if you're with me. 

being a cheap date aside, my friends and i really enjoy dalva and other low key, noncheesy dives that are conducive to conversation and have consistently nice bar men and women who i recognize month after month, and who holla back: "hey. long time no see. where've you been?"

i heart this place. i really do. 

****************************************************

reviewing dalva is like reviewing my appendix. i can't do without it, but when it gives me pains, i gotta give it some attention. did any of that transcendental nonsense make sense? 

anyway, love this bar. this is my go-to place if i'm feelin good, bummed, sexy, wild, tame, lovely, ugly, fatty, skinny, funny, boring....you know. i go. love it. live it. go. now.
author: May T.

description: Dalva's a great place to go to spend a chill night with friends.  Their interesting concoctions are always enjoyable and the DJs are great (sometimes a little loud).  DOUBLE VISION scored the upstairs room for our afterparty to celebrate our April performances, and we fit dozens of people up there.
author: Wendy M.

description:
dalva rocks for all the wrong reasons and that's why i can only come here once every six months now. 

*sigh*. 

needless to say, toph one is a badass. 

i even heart our bartenders, craig and peter and the others, even when they swap out my drinks for water when they think i've had my fill. fuckers. :)
author: Winter R.

description: this place has become my neighborhood refuge.  Never seems too crowded despite its proximity to some other louder, sweatier, scenester joints,  but if your with a smoker, check out the back room, and any bar that plays One upon a time in the West is a ok in y book.  I mean c'mon chuckie b people!!!
author: Eagan I.

description: My favorite Bloody Mary in the city.  I'll never forget a time I ordered one here, and as the bar tender was concocting it the phone rang, he picked it up, and without even saying "hello" or "who is this" he just said "I'm making a Bloody Mary" and hung up.  Now that's dedication!
author: Miss M.

description:
This is a nice bar, not the best layout but its ok.

The crowd is older then Deliriums crowd.
The beer selection is a little better.
author: Henry C.

description: Great bar. They serve Wyder's Pear Cider on tap, which is like...my THING. You can actually move around in here and you don't have to scream, even on a weekend night. The jukebox is free, so I'm with that. Haven't been to the b-room yet, but I heard it's a ones-ie. I plan on coming here more often when I'm near 16th.
author: Shannon R.

description: I'd consider this borderline dive, but not exactly. Blood oranges were in season, so we got a nice cocktail with that stuff which was really delish. And the bartender claimed he was the only one who makes them. I had a Moose Drool beer--somewhere between a Guinness and a Newcastle.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Dalva has been around as long as I can remember - it is one of those local places that is great to start an evening out.  Nice atmoshpere of DJ style music and dark inside.  In case you haven't checked it out, take a seat in the small back room.  Even better, forget the weekend and go there on a Tuesday night when the bar isn't as packed.
author: Annabel G.

description: My favorite bar hands down.  It's dimly lit and cozy...where I like to go on a date after dinner if in the Mission.  It has a backroom so you get have a bigger group hang out there.
author: Julia H.

description:
Five stars for the friendly bartender-Jason.  We had a great Sunday late afternoon bellied up at the bar making friends...and Jason poured the best dirty martinis (best meaning strong).  
Stumbled out of here w/out totally breaking the bank!
author: Amy C.

description: This is a good neighborhood bar. Cheap, strong drinks, good music, mellow crowd. Good place to come to start off the night before hitting up the dance floors. I would definitely come here again =)
author: Nicole K.

description:
I love this bar

i just wish it had another bar area in the back, when it gets crowded, it sometimes takes awhile to get to the front for another round, perhaps i am just lazy.

but, good drinks for sure, friendly staff, not really a pickup joint, it is more like a living room to me.
author: michael m.

description: Davla's would be a fun bar if it weren't for the incredilbly poor set up of the bar. Imagine being in a hallway having to duck people all night and that is what the set up feels like. Unless you get there early for happy hour and get a seat, this place is not worth going to with a sizeable group. Besides, there is no theme. It's kinda loungy but ultmately not because there is no "lounge" in the set up. Only consolations is that they have PBR. A bar without PBR is not a bar. Praise PBR!
author: Steve H.

description:
a dive bar with class. not pretentious at all, rather inviting and fun.
great dj's and a super rad jukebox for the tunes.  in the same vein as skylark and the makeout room, but a notch above.

one of my favs.
author: Tony A.

description: place is cool for 2 or 3 people.  anymore and the place is just too small.  go on weeknights, thurs can be busy.  great place to grab a beer before the theatre.
author: Joe O.

description: A decent bar with decent drinks and an interesting atmosphere at times. I seem to like the place better when they have really good artwork on the walls (which frequently changes) and they pull down their big screen and play "The Good, The Bad and The Ugly" or some obscure anime flick. When these elements don't come together, the bar is just kind of average and it has the tendency to get super hot in there...
author: Michael E.

description: Dalva is one of the places to check out on Sundays and Mondays. The bar is large and bartenders are friendly. They have great happy hour on sake, beers on tap and well drinks on Sun/Mon all night. The back rooms are cool and have a funky decor. If you're there on a weekly night - check out the funny cartoons they play on the projector.
author: Sav B.

description: The back room is the kind of cavernous setting one would expect to find co-conspirators plotting to kill somebody. At least I can smoke back there to take the edge off. The drinks are reasonable, the bartenders aren't jerks, and the fact that I've gotten phone numbers from questionable girls here doesn't hurt my review either... except for one girl who was a total disaster... I'll take a star off for that one, thank you very much.
author: Josh K.

description: This place is a lot of fun. Small but fun. Always have good music. Drinks aren't expensive. DJ is great. I've only gone to this a couple of times but every time was wonderful. A little bit of a more older crowd but it is so diverse that the vibes are wonderful. Definitely have to check this place out. its great.
author: Berenice D.

description: The music here is good, more of a low-key and snappy undertone instead of a glaring roar. You probably hear the roar when the bartender gives you the price of your drink and you find yourself screaming at your own complacency because you always tell yourself "DO NOT PAY TOO MUCH FOR BEER." So this bar provides a dimly lit location for a whopping loud cost. Quiet and loud. Got it? No? Too bad.
author: Kimberly V.

description: Reasonably priced, comfy. Hide from the hipsters in the back room.
author: Kimberley D.

description: Back in the day (okay, like 6 months ago) I used to go to this bar pretty often. Now I have a lifetime ban by proxy -- my friend messed around with someone who works there, things ended badly and now I am forbidden from going. Sucks for me. But when I WAS allowed to go, I actually really liked this place. Decently strong drinks, they show interesting movies along the wall, and the crowd was generally pretty unpretentious. Now if only that employee would quit so I could go back.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Another online review said it best: "Smoking is a tongue in cheek taboo in Dalva's secret back room."
author: Philip M.

description: Beter than average bar in the Mission...went there on a Wednesday and there was a pretty good DJ spinning, a random movie being projected, and good drinks (but only one overworked bartender, so it took my friend about 20-25 minutes for him to get around to her)...
author: Barbara A.

description:
this place was ok, but nothing special.  again, we did the whole, go early and avoid crowds thing, so that was nice.  met up with yelper andrew g here, and music was low enuf we could actually talk.  though as the night got later, i did notice the music got louder. 

drinks didn't seem as strong as some of my other favorite places, so that was kind of a bummer.  since there are so many othe bars to chose from, i probably won't go back till i've made the rounds.
author: Alexis W.

description: Dalva is a nice place to chill when it's not too crowded, so it's basically a good place to start out the night or a good place to end it.  Good jukebox, lots of seating, and a cozy, dark interior.
author: Lisa C.

description: I keep trying to like this place, but so far it has not worked! a few of my friends love to hang here, but I can't see why!!!
author: Maddy S.

description: An solid Mission bar with no pretense and great local flavor. The longtime Dalva bartender and libation specialist Peter makes the best Sidecar in town hands down. And his Manhattans and Margaritas aren't bad either. Peep the "Red Wine Social" on Wednesday nights you'll be privy to listening to Toph One on the decks. Nice
author: Matthew R.

description: If you're one of those people who always has four spots to hit on a Friday night, and tonight your calendar's unexpectedly empty, this is a great spot. It's the off-night spot for scenesters. Can always count on good beats and decent art/films on the wall. Check out hte back room for a private party or a more intimate evening.
author: Seiji C.

description:
eh.

went here saturday.  i still have a fever and my nose is a solid mass of snot.  not blaming it on dalva.  blaming it on the busy-ness of the mission nightlife in general.  

i like my bars less busy.  and that being my first real night out in the mission... i see that it is not the neighborhood for me to really enjoy my weekends.

dalva was chill at least. managed to get a table and the music was pretty decent.  people seemed to be interested in each other, not just huddle into their little groups.

they had coffy on the big screen, with french subtitles.  which was neat, cause i was bored.  so i got to brush up on my french and my blacksplotation movies.  but i shouldn't be bored at a bar neither.

i don't much like screens in bars (unless it's erotic photo-hunt) because it just sucks everyone's attention to it.  but they were playing cool, campy movies.  which i appreciate.

anyway... i would definately give it another go next time i find myself dooped into the area.  though i won't go out of my way for it.
author: Ge O.

description: Dark narrow candlelit bar that shows movies and hosts the occasional dj.  A nice place to grab a drink in the middle of the week.
author: Tim G.

description:
it's more upscale than most bars on the same row, which is always a plus when you want to avoid the dive crowd

drinks aren't expensive, and they take credit card. a stop here is a must.
author: Charles C.

description: Quintessential dive bar, complete with a dingy bathroom. Drinks are ridiculously cheap (at least they were a few years ago), at $3.50 for a basic one. Cozy, fun, and great music. Always a stop when we roam the Mission.
author: Joy C.

description: Back in the dating days, I met up with a few people at this bar. It's probably one of my favorite divey bars in the Mission, because it's completely chill, you can actually have conversations there, the drinks are not really expensive, and the overall vibe and general crowd is cool.
author: Kimi W.

description: I really like this place.  There's something about Dalva that has always made me feel comfortable and it's not familiarity, because I haven't been there too often.  Good drinks and a well-mixed crowd.  Can get pretty crowded on weekends but has a much more relaxed feel on weekdays.  The bar itself is a thin strip that opens up a little bit towards the back, allowing for some tables, but when it's busy don't count on these to be open for a large group.  Music is good and it's been a while since I've been but sometimes they project movies to a back wall.
author: Yen P.

description: Pssst! Dalva has a back area you can smoke in....totally awesome! As for the drinks, they're ok, nothing special. I think you can get sangria and mojitos here that are pretty good though. It is a little pricier than say, Delirium, but it's way more trendier. The crowd is okay too.  Oh, I wouldn't classify Dalva as a dive either, it's just a trendy little bar with a back room to smoke in.
author: Gina R.

description: i have really grown to love this bar. just like an old, worn in pair of jeans. love you, dalva. LOVE YOU SO MUCH.
author: Rachael S.

description: Dalva is my favorite spot for a sidecar, Peter the bartender makes the best in town. And you can count on the music being eclectic and entertaining.
author: Kai H.

description: Good strong drink, eclectic people, eclectic music from the DJ, chill back room.
author: Anony M.

description: Cute little bar on my block, but it is annoying that they don't take credit cards.  Cash only situation.  Kind of hard to start a tab going......
author: Joanna S.

description: I've been there twice now so I feel competent in reviewing this place.  I agree with Nish, that I like meeting up with friends, but it's not that fun when you get there.  I find that I don't really mingle beyond my social circle there, and others do the same.  On top of that, it's a cash only bar, which is really just stifling.
author: Lindsay T.

description: Great location, cozy and dark atmosphere, good drinks selection. The crowd was mellow and friendly.  A refreshing break from the frat-boy/Marina atmosphere that's invaded the block up at Double Dutch. A great place to catch up with friends.
author: Shannon L.

description:
meh.

been here a bunch of times, but never really all that impressed. it's fine i guess. average mission bar.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: Cool, very dimly lit bar that isn't as packed as some of the other more obvious hangouts in the Mission.  Our group had plenty of room to stand around without being elbowed all night, and we even got a table towards the end.  They had THE MOST bizarre movies I have ever seen projected onto the wall in the back - no idea what they were called, but take an acid trip and apply it to small children and clay figurines with inappropriate body parts and you start to get the picture.  Interesting artwork and mysterious back-lit grates on the wall will keep your attention if your conversations ever hit a lull.
author: Nicole C.

description: Great Bar Stools, Great Martini's , Great Bartender's.  A dive for grownups in the Mission
author: Bruce C.

description: great bar, friendly doorman, and bartender.  good beer selection too
author: Kristin L.

description: Great location next to the Roxie cinema. Perfect experience before catching a show. I mostly enjoyed the juke box, the gin concoctions and watching a slew of interesting people.
author: Amanda P.

description: My boyfriend took me here for happy hour a while back and we had a blast. Not many people come for happy hour which makes it that much better. Sometimes when you're with someone special you don't need the big crowds. Since then I have come back a few times for happy hour with friends and they always enjoy the intimacy too. Happy hour specials: $2.75 all wells, beers, and sangria. Sangria is refreshing and will get you drunk fast if that's what you looking for.
author: Jenny C.

description: Good selection on tap and in the bottle.  Very quaint feeling and dim lighting make it more of a date bar than a group bar in my opinion.
author: Joel M.

description:
the bar tender was attentive and poured stiff drinks. really nice, mellow energy in this place. just like every bar in the mission, its busy on the weekends and i prefer to hang out on a week night.
i'll be back.
author: City G.

description: Well I can honestly say that the owners of this spot are the coolest sweetest people, and they make the best Sangria, it makes you happy........
author: baretta v.

description: Great long dark old SF bar. Can't beat it for smart funny staff, good drinks and a smoking area out back. top marks for location too.
