author: Stephen K.

description: Best lemon-drop, period.  Great juke box.
author: Chris D.

description: Good Long Island Ice Teas + They Play Led Zeppelin = Nice!
author: Heirloom Z.

description:
This review primarily concerns Poetry Mission--2nd and 4th Thursdays in the 'secret back room.'  This is most definitely one of my favourite places for poetry--not only to read my own work, but to listen to others.

Many open-mic events suffer a seemingly inexorable din from the rest of the coffeehouse/bar--hissing espresso machines, chatter among non-participating patrons, etc.--that makes it next-to-impossible to really listen and consider words.  Not so at Dalva; the main reason being that everyone in the back room is actually there to listen; otherwise they'd be on the other side of the door, in the bar itself.  Walking in, it feels a bit like the scene from Fight Club; the one where everyone is walking straight through the bar to the basement as Tom Waits' "Goin' Out West" plays on the jukebox.

Host Jonathan Siegel puts considerable effort into summoning strong, talented feature performers, and it shows.  Often, the only complaint is that the back room is packed too tight, and all those bodies make the temperature rather uncomfortable.  If ever one wanted to re-live the Beat scene of yesteryear--dimly lit rooms packed with silently contemplative interesteds--this is as close as it gets...
author: J. Brandon L.

description: Decent Mission bar.  The cash-only thing really irks me---it doesn't make you a dive bar, guys, regardless of what the yelp category might say.  Anyway, good drinks, nice dark decor, silent movies playing on the wall.  3.5 stars.
author: Alex T.

description: Week nights are best, when you can get a spot at the bar and enjoy the ambience. Sometimes they've got great DJs. The backroom usually has space for a group and on nights when the music is obnoxious makes it more bearable. The drinks are typically well poured. Only had one bad experience where a bartender was too busy pouring himself and cute girls drinks (sadly not me) and ignoring most of the rest of the bar. Out of all the bars on 16th this is the one I'll most likely visit when I feel like being out but don't feel like dealing with hipster crowds.
author: Lisa P.

description: Dalva is super close to BART, so the East Bay friends have no problem meeting me here, which is a good thing for me.  As for bars in the Mission, so far Dalva is my kind of place.  Happy hour, funny/campy movies, sweet bartender/owner, and a relaxed feeling and crowd.  I will be coming back here for sure, especially when meeting the kids from my hometown in the city.  Important FYI...strong drinks.  Good thing when you're in the mood, bad thing when you weren't expecting it.  Regardless, Dalva is hip, but not too hip, ya dig?
author: Meg C.

description:
Well this is a tough one... dark bar, not crowded, some weird old SciFi film playing on a giant screen. What could go wrong?
Let me tell you: ordering something called "Drink with no name" from the drinks menu. Worst drink ever.
Ok sure maybe it was my fault for actually not getting something straightforward... but it was on the menu, right? One question - why?
author: Pablo P.

description: I like hitting up Dalva on Sunday night for a little pre-work week Karaoke. KJ Paul is awesome and it's a fun spot to sing. They make really tasty (and large) cocktails, which i enjoy consuming.
author: juan r.

description: good staff. good location. smoking room in the back. usually it's a decent dj ... sometimes the dj could suck, but i'm usually in the back room smoking and getting loaded with my friends and i hardly even notice the dj. sometimes the crowd could be a little weird. but i'm liking this place more and more these days ...
author: James J.

description: cool place. i really, really can't stand television and am often turned off by bars that have two, three, four turned on, but a projector, that's different- kung fu & vodka tonics... nice.
author: vincent m.

description: Charleton Heston in The Poseidon Adventure on a muted big-screen projector make this the right place to go for drinks in the city.
author: ted p.

description: this place has such a mysterious vibe, since it's so dark.  they have great beers on tap, but rather than get a beer, i had a pomegranate mojito here.  grab a seat in the back if you want to have an intimate conversation.
author: Helen T.

description: one of our favorite bars in the mission. on a weekday that is. it gets too loud and crowded on the weekend but its a nice place to have a drink with friends during the week.
author: Jared Z.

description: Ever have one of those quintessentially San Francisco nights out in the mission? Yea, us too. We started the night in the relaxing recesses of  Dalva on 16th Street. Dimly light with red cylindrical glass candle-holders on each dark stained wooden table, it was a perfect atmosphere for a low-key beginning to a long night. The classic B movies they play make Dalva more speakeasy dive than trendy nightspot which was a crowd-pleaser for our group. There's no sense in going to Blondie's, you might as well be in the Marina or Cow Hollow. At Dalva, they played the bizarre and wonderful "The Snake People" and if you haven't seen it- it isn't to be missed (Voodoo, Hoodoo, and gyrating half naked people). We watched the movie projected on the large back wall of the place as we sipped our beverages. It was beers all around. The drinks are standard for this type of watering hole. Nothing out of the ordinary except a great spot to chill and (for my ever-so classy friend) a spot in the very back to make out with some guy in a dark corner. Not to be missed.
author: Jessica D.

description: sit towards the front at the bar and it's a pretty nice crowd with ok drinks and tunes. once met and dated an MIT dropout that then went to NYU's film school. generally meet interesting peeps here.
author: miriam b.

description: met some friends here for drinks before dinner.  drinks are cheap and strong. i had one glass of sangria and i have to admit i was a little buzzed when we left. my friend went to select some songs on the jukebox and said that there were already 24 credits in the machine...so he didn't have to pay for any songs but thought that it would be best to repay the credits he used. paying it forward i suppose. =)
author: Linda N.

description: boooo cash only...thats what prevented this spot from havin a 5 star review from yours truly....for sure a stop over while bar hopping in the mission...yeah its dark & errie kinda divey....i dont recommend it as a spot with the fellas...but a spot u can take your date to for drink or two
author: elmer d.

description: no matter when i go, whether it's during the work week, weekend, after work, after dinner, late night, it's always a nice spot to get a drink.  there's always a good group of mellow, laidback people, it's got an intimate vibe, and you can actually hear yourself talk.
author: Bird B.

description: i like this place. not sure why. oh yea, they make one of the best tequila gimlets i've had in the city--with fresh lime juice and a little simple syrup (most places use rose's lime juice...bleh). crowd varies depending on the night, but overall i've had lots of good times here.
author: dusty d.

description: This is my home away from home. I love this place, but I'm definitely a bit partial since a few friends work there. Wednesday nights are my favorite nights here with DJ Toph One holding his Red Wine Socials here every week. Bari has been playing some soulful tunes on Tuesday - definitely a bright spot in my week. Peter - my favorite grumpy bartender - makes a mean cosmo and french martini. Beware of Jimmy's chocolate cakes - oy. The backroom is definitely a fun spot to reserve for private parties. The weekend nights brings meat and cheesy goodness... sometimes badness - definitely more of a fan during the week.
author: J K.

description: Dalva is one of my favorite bars in SF! And it keeps getting better. Right after Thanksgiving they are opening a little hide-out bar in the back. Dalva will serve great cocktails and offer a very deep selection of spirits. I am looking forward to it!
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Dalva is at its best during the week, when you can get your fix of the non-pretentious bar ambience, fab jukebox tracks and Stella on tap without fighting thru the late weekend crowds. Staff are great.   You can never have too many Dalva evenings.
author: georgie p.

description: i like this place.  and if your company is boring, you can just stare off in the general direction of the movie screen which is bound to be playing something strange that you will eventually become consumed by.
author: Joanne L.

description: dalva...love it. nicely lit inside, AMAZING happy hour specials, seems to attract groups of people who clearly just like being there and with each other without needing a "scene" to look past their friends for. thinking about it makes me want to run my hands along the uneven, concrete walls. wait, did i just say that out loud?
author: julia r.

description: Definitely a three: not great, but not bad either.  Cool atmosphere with all sorts of candles and a new level of bar darkness.  They were playing this brutal anime film one night - strange how violent, X-rated anime can draw you in...
author: J R.

description: smoke friendly in the back room. always something interesting playing on the screen at night. by interesting, i mean odd, obscure, and old. i hear they make a mean mojito - wouldnt know myself, dont care for the mojito. good mix of folks; not marina'esk, but also not flooded with mission hipsters or emo drunks. grab a drink and talk smack with some friends.
author: Darrell L.

description: laid back and comfy. bartender's great and this is one of the place you can become a regular in very quickly. smoking section in back.
author: Hae-Jin K.

description: Grab a falafel from next door and have a sangria here. It's the best dinner experience when you are feeling casual.  Dalva is cool for just a laid back night of hanging with friends.
author: Misti L.

description: great bar. dark s fuck. mellow. always drowded on weekends. perfect mid week watering hole. cool shit goes on in the back room too. if you like poetry...poetry mission happens there first thursdays. its pretty dope. check it out. ****great place to meet for a drink for the first time****
author: Dave L.

description: dalva's a good, basic bar to go to when you're not sure where else to go.  a few years ago, i'd hear good music there sometimes.  lately everytime i've been in, the music's not so hot.  when i smoked i loved the back smoking room, that was one plus about this place.  it's small but has a few tables and keeps the smoke mostly separate from the rest of the bar.  this bar has Good Lighting, which i always appreciate.
author: Kate W.

description: last stop of the night, dalva. what a great choice! although my mind was a bit cloudy from the other bars we went to, i do remember the great selection of beer they had on tap. i was excited to see that they had stone beer which comes from a san diego brewing company and im from san diego, nice. i got some sort of IIPA and let me tell you i couldve kept going all night. for a saturday night it was alright!! not too crowded or pretentious. the bartenders were helpful and looked like they were having a good time, very importante. i liked the movie they had playing, another plus. will be back when im in sf!
author: phoebe r.

description: It was pretty empty on a Friday night at midnightish so I guess it's more of a place to go earlier, but still it's cool. The big ass TV is nice. The drinks went down easy. I was really wasted and the company sorta sucked, but I would go back to this place. It had a nice feel.
author: Hmmm W.

description: ah, dalva. i've had celebrations, first dates, drunken birthday parties, my purse stolen, quiet happy hours.... and the beginnings of many long nights here. it's like a little institution in my san francisco life. i'm a big fan of toph's red wine social on wednesdays, although now that i'm all grown up and can't justify going out on a weds night, i rarely attend. i know, adulthood suxxx. good sangria and actually a good red wine list - they have a gnarly head zin that i really like! i love the dark, dimly lit candle ambiance. a mission tradition (i rhymed).
author: Mary V.

description: If you're in the mission on 16th street you've most likely passed this unassuming dive nestled in between the Roxy and Delirium on your way to either of these places. Its small but never terribly crowded and there's a chill smoking backroom for those of you who need a break from the sweaty, non-stop dance party at Delirium. Great music, incredible JukeBox Selections, and the hipster vibe minus the pretention.
author: Sequoia N.

description: This place has a great little back room for real conversations and great DJ's. They just came out with a new cocktail list and the crowd is mixed. it's old school mission without all the pretension, one of the first bars to turn the mission. The weekends are packed, so I prefer going during the week. Local art is always changing on the walls and it's usually really great art students that are showing.
author: lita b.

description: Sorry, every time I've been to Dalva, people are smoking indoors (despite the posted No Smoking sign, and oh yeah, the law).  It is not worth having smelly hair and clothes to hang out at this place.  Unless you love choking on second hand smoke.
author: Sheila S.
